answers.answer: My mother in law is 4' 11" and had my husband without a c section and he was over 9 lbs. But if you've had problems progressing in the past you'll have to weigh your options. I'm going for a vbac, but I was progressing fine with my first. The c section was due other reasons. Will your doctor let you try a vbac knowing it may result in a c section?

Idk. He is very strict about the safety of me and the baby. My mother had  all 3 of us naturally and we were all large babies. My brother broke her pelvic bone coming out and she had her appendix rupture after having me. My first csec was because I had developed preeclampsia. I wasn't even in labor and no signs of labor that was at 37weeks 4dys with twins.  So far no preeclampsia signs with this baby but I do have gestational diabetes

I am 4'10 and after hours of labor ended up needing a cesarean with my first he was 8.6. My ob is all about vbabs and is hopeful I can have one but suspects my daughter is going to be at least as big as first baby so well see.

I had a placental abruption and uterine rupture on my first child. In 2009 - due our second in January and I have to have section again.I was upset too because I want to experience labour and vaginally birthing but unfortunately its just not safest option.So I do know how you feel - I'd urge you to do whats safest for you and baby♡Best of luck x

Vbacs are safe. If things are working out well you just do a csection. But het at least you tried. Now in your case ash having had the rupture etc id agree for you it's better not to try :-( which really stinks. I get so upset when ftm mom's just want tip jump to cesarean when there are so many women that end up needing a cesarean and simply want to be able to experience labor and birth natural it ***** :-(

question: wondering should I fight the idea of csec. again? I had a csec With my twins almost 3 years ago. I want a vbac this time but I am measuring so large it shocks my dr. Each time he sees me,he has been an obgyn for 30 years. He was fine with vbac at first , the more he sees me ,more he is getting worried i will have over 9lb baby and stresses how tiny i am. He is scared the baby will do alot damage to me naturally birthing,there's a risk of uterine rupture. Your thoughts?  vbac anyway so no regret not having the experience or do csec. and lower risk for me?
title: want deliver natural, baby is very large I am 5ft tall very small in vg  Dr.worried
